Modifier mixin

It should be used inside block mixin that works as wrapper and check if modifier is used inside it or inside element.

@include block ('button') {
  background: #ccc;
  color: #000;
  display: inline-block;
  padding: 4px 8px;

  @include modifier ('error') {
    background: #f02052;

    @include element ('text') {
      color: #fff;
    }
  }

  @include element ('text') {
    font-size: 12px;

    @include modifier ('action') {
      font-weight: 700;
    }
  }
}

The mixin element needs to be wrapped inside block, an also used inside modifier or a pseudo class selector as :hover, :focus etc.

.button {
  background: #ccc;
  color: #000;
  display: inline-block;
  padding: 4px 8px;
}
.button--error {
  background: #f02052;
}
.button--error .button__text {
  color: #fff;
}
.button__text {
  font-size: 12px;
}
.button__text--action {
  font-weight: 700;
}

Using and element directly inside another element will throw an error because there is no reason to nest them and create additional selector nesting.
